content:
Is there anywhere a guide on how to read these rustc performance datas? I'm never quite sure how to interpret them and what exactly they're saying. For example this: https://perf.rust-lang.org/compare.html?start=7b0e554ee2c94e9b3865a8c2d24d720224512dec&end=09e65b93444d3fdbdf689eaa60f41443a12d0711 Is this now overall an improvement or not?

Actually, I just got an idea. Could it be that the top (coercions-debug to deep-vector-debug) is the runtime performance and the part below beginning with bootstrap timings; variance is 1-3% on smaller benchmarks! Values in seconds. is the compile-time performance? Is that correct?
If that's correct, is it right to say that compile time performance improved here but runtime performance worsened?

Sort of? The bootstrap times are how long the compiler tool to compile itself, the others are how long it took to compile some benchmarks. "Runtime" and "compiletime" are ambiguous in this context - bootstrap timings are measuring the stage 2 compiler IIRC, not beta
In general the bootstrap time is not as important as the benchmark time (although I'd still love to improve it)
Also the changes for bootstrap in the commit you linked are just noise, remember that it uses timings to measure those and not instruction count
